meanings.sent1: She had an antiliterary attitude, preferring movies over books.
meanings.sent2: The antiliterary student refused to read the assigned novel for class.
meanings.sent3: His antiliterary behavior at the library raised a few eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti artist's work was a bold and antiliterary statement.
meanings.sent5: The dark, antiliterary clouds seemed to block out the sun entirely.

meanings.definition: Not conforming to literary standards or conventions.
meanings.sent1: The experimental poet's antiliterary style challenged traditional norms.
meanings.sent2: Her antiliterary approach to storytelling captivated a niche audience.
meanings.sent3: The antiliterary font choice on the poster made it difficult to read.
meanings.sent4: The artist's antiliterary interpretation of the classic tale was refreshing.
meanings.sent5: The play's antiliterary dialogue added a modern twist to the performance.
